page.title: 09STORNOWAY HARBOUR - FISHING
page.content: {FISHING:}There are about 35 fishing boats.{Prawns}are mainly caught although there is a{white fish by-catch as well, and they take in {sand eels}which are taken to the fish meal factory where they are processed for fish meal and oil. {Prawns}are tailed and the tails are processed at Goat Island.{Herring}is also caught but not often. The biggest buyers at the Fish-Mart are; the Stornoway Fishermans' Co-op, who buy most of the fish for themselves, Youngs Seafoods who have a factory, which is down at Goat Island, for{prawns, shellfish {and lobsters.} Most of the catch goes to the Aberdeen market. The vessels in the Stornoway fishing fleet are between 40-70 feet in length.
